content: It is possible to set a monospaced font in VSCode? But most importantly, I need it to display all characters that are used in Lean. I work in the default settings and I hate how ⟨ is thinner than other characters.
If you dislike ⟨, then you may also dislike ⊹ and ₊... :upside_down:
Apart from the Amazon suggestions, though, I am not able to help, sorry!

There is a relatively new font that might be of benefit for what you seek which is free.

JetBrains Mono

JetBrains is a company known for creating Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) for popular programming languages.
Mono refers to the fact that the font is a monospaced font meaning each glyph takes the same width.

The only downside I have found with the font is that it is not a predefined option in the font list of many tools so the font has to be downloaded and installed. (instructions) Other than that it is one of my go to fonts now.

One interesting side note about JetBrains Mono, there is a WOFF (Web Open Font Format) version.

Glad you resolved the problem. :smile:

For others reading this, when setting the option for the font in VSCode, as with most VSCode settings they can be set for the user or the workspace. If you choose user it will set it for ALL uses of VSCode which you may not desire.
